intro: Justicia cyanantha, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its striking blue-violet bracts that surround clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Justicia cyanantha thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
